DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no response regarding whether a usually exophytic mass attached to the underlying tissue by a broad base or a thin stalk has been surgically removed from part or all of a structure or organ.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A usually exophytic mass attached to the underlying tissue by a broad base or a thin stalk.  Polyps can be neoplastic or non-neoplastic.  Neoplastic polyps usually represent proliferations of the epithelium, and are commonly seen in the gastrointestinal tract.  Polyps of the gastrointestinal tract are often called adenomas, are associated with dysplasia, and may eventually transform into carcinomas.  Non-neoplastic polyps may be inflammatory, degenerative, or the result of malformations._of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A usually exophytic mass attached to the underlying tissue by a broad base or a thin stalk.  Polyps can be neoplastic or non-neoplastic.  Neoplastic polyps usually represent proliferations of the epithelium, and are commonly seen in the gastrointestinal tract.  Polyps of the gastrointestinal tract are often called adenomas, are associated with dysplasia, and may eventually transform into carcinomas.  Non-neoplastic polyps may be inflammatory, degenerative, or the result of malformations. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A usually exophytic mass attached to the underlying tissue by a broad base or a thin stalk.  Polyps can be neoplastic or non-neoplastic.  Neoplastic polyps usually represent proliferations of the epithelium, and are commonly seen in the gastrointestinal tract.  Polyps of the gastrointestinal tract are often called adenomas, are associated with dysplasia, and may eventually transform into carcinomas.  Non-neoplastic polyps may be inflammatory, degenerative, or the result of malformations.

Property.preferredDefinition: of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.:Removal or excision by surgical measures.

Concepts.definition: of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the participant had a complete excision of all observed polyps in qualifying colonoscopy?
